algorithm_technique: DFS to find cycle, then BFS from cycle nodes to find distances
problem_summary_simple: Find the shortest distance from each node to any node in the graph's single cycle.
problem_summary_technical: Uses DFS to identify cycle nodes, then BFS starting from all cycle nodes simultaneously to compute distances.
key_insights: The problem guarantees exactly one cycle, simplifying cycle detection.
A multi-source BFS starting from all cycle nodes is efficient for distance calculation.
DFS is suitable for finding the cycle by detecting back-edges.
